question: What is the westernmost point of the continent of Africa?
explanation: Cap-Vert, also known as the Cape Verde Peninsula, is a peninsula in Senegal. It is the westernmost point of the continent of Africa. It is also known as Cabo Verde or Green Cape. Cape Verde Islands got its name from this peninsula. It is a combination of volcanic offshore islands. It is projected towards the Atlantic Ocean. It was the transatlantic ferrying point during World War II. "Lebous" are the indigenous inhabitants of this peninsula.
